p: The replication cycle of alphaviruses is initiated by virion attachment to cells, followed by clathrin-mediated endocytosis leading to internalization of the viral particle. Particle uncoating exposes the viral genome to the cytoplasm [ 4], which serves as a template for RNA transcription and translation of the non-structural proteins. Virus particle formation then takes place when structural proteins encapsulate the nascent genomic RNA and finally egress by budding from the cells [ 4].
